content: What courses on FHIR do you know?
the MOOG and course at Georgia Tech run by @Mark Braunstein and now coming to Queensland Australia
@Simone Heckmann has done work in this space too
@nicola (RIO/SS) are you specifically asking for academical courses or just training in general?
ping @Patrick Werner @Viet Nguyen @René Spronk

As a provider of HL7/IHE/DICOM training courses we're providing a FHIR overview, a FHIR profiling, and a FHIR advanced training course. But those are not aimed at academia persé. Next to that we provide post-grad courses related to IHE XDS and 'interoperability standards' at Eindhoven university in the Netherlands. These are relatively brief 3-hour sessions.

The Heilbronn University of Applied Sciences in cooperation with the Universidad de Chile Santiago, Chile held 6 different BPMN and FHIR workshops over the last 2 years. Focus was analyzing health processes, identification of inter-organization communications and the usage of FHIR to do this communication in an interoperable manner. The last workshops were more profiling and implementation prototyping with hapi and VUE.js frontends.

There is a profiling academy on Simplifier:
https://simplifier.net/guide/profilingacademy

Note that there's also a stream for discussing topics and content of the Profiling Academy: https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/108-Profiling-Academy It would be nice to hear your ideas!

Also, we offer a Student Track at the FHIR DevDays, which is a great opportunity for students and phds to learn about FHIR and meet each other: https://www.fhirdevdays.com/amsterdam/student-track/
